segments.text: My heart is practically in my throat watching that boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a two-step stool, but its legs are clearly splayed and tilted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks incredibly unstable, almost on the verge of toppling backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His body is stretched so far upwards, reaching desperately for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: One wrong move, one shift in weight, and he'll be crashing down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can just picture him falling and hitting his head, or breaking that plate he holds.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl standing nearby doesn't seem to notice the danger, only the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me incredibly anxious to see such a precarious situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't the woman noticing this obvious hazard right behind her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone should really stabilize that stool or tell him to get down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The impending accident feels so incredibly real, even in this drawing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope he manages to get his cookies without injury.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is definitely the most concerning part of the entire scene for me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of a child getting hurt makes me feel absolutely sick.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them about the danger they are in.
segments.speaker: PAR
